rComments: Goff's part of this class was pretty hard if you didn't really study the book and the quizzes online. She also used clickers which sucks because that means you actually have to go to class regularly.

She is a terrible professor. She gave incorrect information in lecture, and when I asked her about it she agreed with me but was EXTREMELY hesitant to tell the class, and when she did, barely mentioned it. She would rather give out bad info than appear to be wrong. Speeds through lecture and assumes you know everything prior to lecture. AVOID!

This teacher is a wolf in sheep's clothing. Her tests are 100% book based, and her lectures are very general.  She expects every detail to be know for tests. She also assigns online quizzes that take a while.  Plus homework in class and in section. She says in the beginning that her class is a part-time job. AVOID her if possible.

Goff begins her class by trying to get her students to love plants, but fails. She speeds through her lectures, and refuses to slow down despite multiple student requests. Her tests were difficult, not relating to her lectures at all. She had numerous pointless assignments. I also had a terrible TA, which made the class even worse.

very bad at teaching, just clicks through powerpt slides and expects you to learn souly by reading and rereading the book, even then the exam wasn't a piece of cake! def. don't take the class with her, its a really interesting subject that she makes super boring!
Extremely hard teacher. Goes really fast in lecturer, doesn't post notes online. Online quizzes are really long. Quizzes and midterm involve way too much detail. Avoid taking her if possible.

Lectures are all power point, and she expects you to remember a great deal in detail without going over it, basically you have to read the book and be sure to take notes out of the book rather than taking notes in class. She's not that great at teaching at all!
She is funny but is a pain doing the work. Not worth taking unless you are a plant nut
